p: β-Caryophyllene is reported to possess anticancer, analgesic [ 34], anticonvulsant [ 35], anti-inflammatory [ 36], antioxidant, and antimicrobial activities [ 37], and its abundance, especially in the E, EQ, and ESEG varieties, makes them a possible source of this compounds. As a result, β-caryophyllene was described as a potential agent to treat several diseases due to its activity [ 38]. In addition, globulol, which was the highest compound in the RI variety, is reported to have various biological activities, such as antifungal [ 39] and antibacterial activities [ 40]. RI is also abundant in nerolidol and reported to possess antileishmanial [ 41], antiparasitic [ 42], antimalarial [ 43], and antimicrobial activities [ 44].
